The study of economics examines how societies allocate scarce resources.
Supply and demand form the foundation of market dynamics.
Prices signal value and coordinate economic activity.
Competition drives innovation and efficiency improvements.

Markets can fail due to externalities and information asymmetries.
Government intervention sometimes corrects these failures.
Regulation aims to protect consumers and ensure fair competition.
Economic policy affects employment, inflation, and growth.

International trade connects economies across borders.
Comparative advantage explains patterns of specialization.
Exchange rates influence the flow of goods and capital.
Trade agreements reduce barriers and promote economic integration.
